form.label: Cron Toolkit - Scheduled Search Analysis
form.description: Analyze cron schedules on saved searches.

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=local search="disabled=0" search="is_scheduled=1" search="eai:acl.owner=\"$owner$\"" search="eai:acl.app=\"$app_name$\"" | search title="$search_name$" | fields title eai:acl.app eai:acl.owner cron_schedule | rename eai:acl.app as app, eai:acl.owner as owner, title as search_name, cron_schedule as schedule | eval start_time="$start_time$", end_time="$end_time$" | eval start_time=case(start_time == "now", now(), isnull(start_time) OR start_time == "", null(), true(), relative_time(now(), start_time)) | eval end_time=case(end_time == "now", now(), isnull(end_time) OR end_time == "", null(), true(), relative_time(now(), end_time)) | croncountruns schedule=schedule end=end_time start=start_time limit=$trigger_count_limit$ | fields search_name app owner schedule trigger_count | sort - trigger_count | head $result_limit$
